column4: hi, does anyone know how to get Fiesty to scan for wireless networks?
sudo iwlist eth1 scan

it used to work until I did the recent update

that's how you can scan man

jordan_u: uh it sees my card, I just can't see (connect) to my network
if you do sudo iwlist eth1 scan it tells you what networks are out there
crazytom: I click on network config, it does not display the wireless network
just do sudo iwconfig eth1 essid laptops
yup
crazytom: is something supposed to happen?
nope
crazytom: okay. Done that
do sudo iwconfig eth1 key yourkeyhere
does WPA work?
crazytom:Error for wireless request "Set Encode" (8B2A) : invalid argument "my key here"
you have got to be kidding right?  use your wep key. it's probably a number.
my network is set on a WPA key
ok, i'll change it
then you're going to have to install wpasupplicant if it's not already installed
